title: How to Make a Twig Floor Lamp

steps.headline: Find a suitable frame for your lampshade.
steps.description: You can recycle if you have a broken one, or go to the junkyard and look; all you need is the upper part of the lamp, or the shade frame.

steps.headline: Strip the shade.
steps.description: Remove all fabrics, screws, and other unwanted parts; you are just going to need the frame.

steps.headline: Clean the frame.
steps.description: Grab a 100 grit sandpaper and scrape off any rusty parts.

steps.headline: Paint the frame if you want to.
Cut about 5 inch (12.7 cm) in diameter of wood.
steps.description: This will serve as the base and is where you will mount your lighting kit.

steps.headline: Get some metal plating and cut about an inch-long piece.
Buy a lighting kit and a dimmer switch.
steps.description: You can get these pre-assembled from a hardware store.

steps.headline: Mount your lighting kit on top of the base.
Gather your twigs.
steps.description: They should be roughly the same length and size as one another, and long enough to span from the top to the bottom of the lamp frame.

steps.headline: Tie the twine around the frame.
steps.description:
Roll the twine around the base until you are happy with the look. This adds a decorative touch and will also help as you place and attach the twigs to the frame. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/66\/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/66\/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Line up your twigs on the frame.
steps.description: You can trim them if you want to, depending on your preference.

steps.headline: Tie the twigs to the frame temporarily using a zip tie or wire.
steps.description:
You just need to hold the twigs in place; you will be removing these wires after you have secured the twigs to the frame of the lamp. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/22\/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/22\/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Trim the top of your twigs to your liking.
Wrap a few rounds of twine around the top of the lamp.
steps.description: This should match the twine you wrapped around the base, and it will help hold the twigs in place.

steps.headline: Roll about an inch of twine in the mid section of the lamp, if desired.
steps.description: At this point your lamp is almost complete. Add more twigs if you think they're needed as the look comes together.

steps.headline: Cut and remove the wires or zip ties that you used to temporarily bind the twigs together.
Create a diffuser.
steps.description:
You can use plain white paper or tracing paper. Roll and insert your diffuser in the center of your lampshade. Get a 15-20 watt bulb and screw it in on the light socket. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c8\/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-18Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-18Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c8\/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-18Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-18Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Enjoy your twig lamp!
steps.description: Since your lampshade has a dimmer switch, adjust the lighting to your preference.

text:
Find a suitable frame for your lampshade. You can recycle if you have a broken one, or go to the junkyard and look; all you need is the upper part of the lamp, or the shade frame. Strip the shade. Remove all fabrics, screws, and other unwanted parts; you are just going to need the frame. Clean the frame. Grab a 100 grit sandpaper and scrape off any rusty parts. Paint the frame if you want to. Cut about 5 inch (12.7 cm) in diameter of wood. This will serve as the base and is where you will mount your lighting kit. Get some metal plating and cut about an inch-long piece. Drill a hole on each end. This will be your bracket that will attach the base to the frame of the lamp. Screw the base to the frame of the lamp using the bracket. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make sure the base is secured to the frame. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Buy a lighting kit and a dimmer switch. You can get these pre-assembled from a hardware store. Mount your lighting kit on top of the base. Gather your twigs. They should be roughly the same length and size as one another, and long enough to span from the top to the bottom of the lamp frame. Tie the twine around the frame. Roll the twine around the base until you are happy with the look. This adds a decorative touch and will also help as you place and attach the twigs to the frame. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/66/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/66/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Line up your twigs on the frame. You can trim them if you want to, depending on your preference. Tie the twigs to the frame temporarily using a zip tie or wire. You just need to hold the twigs in place; you will be removing these wires after you have secured the twigs to the frame of the lamp. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Trim the top of your twigs to your liking. Wrap a few rounds of twine around the top of the lamp. This should match the twine you wrapped around the base, and it will help hold the twigs in place. Roll about an inch of twine in the mid section of the lamp, if desired. At this point your lamp is almost complete. Add more twigs if you think they're needed as the look comes together. Cut and remove the wires or zip ties that you used to temporarily bind the twigs together. Create a diffuser. You can use plain white paper or tracing paper. Roll and insert your diffuser in the center of your lampshade. Get a 15-20 watt bulb and screw it in on the light socket. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-18Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-18Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-18Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Twig-Floor-Lamp-Step-18Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Enjoy your twig lamp! Since your lampshade has a dimmer switch, adjust the lighting to your preference.
